Bibliographic References: PAdd, p. 2, no. A 2; PhV2, p. 50, no. 77; OMC3, p. 104; Pucci e Testoni, Paestum, p. 58; Megale Hellas, fig. 630 (colour)
Imagery Description: (i) WhiteNon Sepcifiedhaired phlyax (mask L) leaning forward beside a door; (ii) lower part of phlyax seated on altar. The scene took place upon a curtained stage (cf. no. 100), of which a part remains below the altar, decorated with fanNon Sepcifiedpalmettes and lotus
